item.title: Importing 725,000 Records into Dynamics GP in Just Half a Minute
item.description:
In a recent project, I tackled a complex integration challenge for a client dealing with large-volume remittance data. This client received consolidated monthly payments from major trading partners, accompanied by massive remittance advice files. These files, reaching sizes of 140MB and containing up to 725,000 rows, detailed the allocation of the payments across thousands of customer invoices. Previously, the client’s accounting team manually processed these files in Excel, painstakingly entering transactions and applying payments...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/importing-725-000-records-into-dynamics-gp-in-just-half-a-minute/

item.title: Incomplete Explanation of eConnect 2010 "Distributed Transaction" Warnings
item.description:
In a previous blog entry, I discussed encountering numerous eConnect 2010 warning messages in my Windows Event Log. These messages, stating “Distributed transaction was used,” were concerning due to their sheer volume. I received helpful feedback from a knowledgeable individual named Louis, who clarified the meaning behind these warnings. He explained that eConnect 2010 normally avoids distributed transactions for performance reasons. Therefore, the warnings indicated that my import process was triggering these transactions, potentially impacting efficiency...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/incomplete-explanation-of-econnect-2010-distributed-transaction-warnings/
